etymology.description: 员(員) (yuán, "person") + 工(工) (gōng, "work") = person who works -> employee
etymology.interpretation: The combination of 员(員) (yuán, "person") and 工(工) (gōng, "work") logically denotes an "employee," someone who is employed to perform work. The term succinctly captures the role of an individual in a workplace setting.

examples.chinese: 我是公司的员工(我是公司的員工)。
examples.english: I’m an employee of the company.

examples.chinese: 这个公司有很多员工(這個公司有很多員工)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège gōngsī yǒu hěn duō yuángōng.
